New Records: Sikandar Raza became the first Zimbabwean batter to surpass 2000 T20I runs.
Key Match Events: Yashasvi Jaiswal scored an outstanding 93 runs off just 53 balls.
Shubman Gill scored his second half-century of the series.
Khaleel Ahmed took 2 wickets for 32 runs.
Sikandar Raza scored a quickfire 46 runs off 28 balls.
India chased down 153 runs in 15.2 overs without losing a wicket.
India won the match by 10 wickets and sealed the series 3-1.
Pre-Game Insights: Shubman Gill mentioned that chasing was a key focus for the team.
Sikandar Raza stated that their target was around 160, which they considered to be a par score.
Post-Match Reflections: Shubman Gill expressed his happiness with his first series win as captain.
Yashasvi Jaiswal enjoyed his batting and mentioned that the new ball was coming onto the bat nicely.
Sikandar Raza acknowledged India's exceptional batting performance and expressed hope for a stronger comeback in the final game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was slightly on the slower side initially, possibly due to it being a bit damp.
Shubman Gill won the toss for the fourth consecutive time on this tour.
